title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments:
Finished Mortal Shell last night. 

For a team of a little over ten people it's a fantastic effort.
Been playing Hades. Awesome rogue lite by a small studio. It's available on Gamepass and on Steam.

Idk if this is the right thread but anyone know the best option for a tablet at around 20K ( can increase to 25k if the option is really good) to play cod mobile? I'm not a fan of iPad as I've never used apple and I like to pirate stuff too so having lots of storage with SD card would be nice, so if the file system is restrictive ( correct me if I'm wrong)
Playing "The Artful Escape". It has stunning visuals, but the gameplay gets boring quickly.
Playing stardew valley. Seems interesting but right now most of the items are locked and it's too tedious to water my crops with a water cane.
If I were you I'd just buy a used PS4.
Deltarune Ch 1 and 2 are free on steam so playing right now
Indians don't really understand how bad mobile gaming is as compared to console and that's sad.

I don't want consoles, i dont spend time at home enough to have a big screen tv, console, sit down and play peacefully being in a medical internship with 12+ hours in the hospital sometimes 


Plus the tablet has other uses like reading and studying, watching lectures etc on the go

Excuse me, did you just start judging an entire country and it's people over their choice of gaming ? 


I was an avid pc gamer and know that console / pc games are obviously better but I don't have the time or resources to sit down and play in front of a big screen tv and console / pc in life being in a hectic medical residency. 



Cod mobile is as good content wise as the console cods Btw, some may argue its even better than the current cold War.
The game is a fricking gem. Music, voice acting, everything is top tier

Bro don’t care what these people have to say. I have a 2080Ti and played a lot on many consoles before and I spent the second half of 2020 playing a lot of Codm arena. It’s genuinely a good FPS. 

I used to play on iPad Air 3 with gyroscope on had a blast playing search and destroy and other modes on arena. A bit more expensive but so far has been worth it since I’ve used it a lot even apart from gaming (Apart from having a touch issue which was solved under warranty which was fortunate). I would suggest one of Samsung tabs with a decent processor(S5e had sd670 and others that have sd8XX processors) or any ipad (A12 and up).

I too don’t like Apple but for 25-30k even the base iPad with A12 would be a good deal if you mainly want some major games and proper use like Netflix,study etc. although it doesn’t have that good a screen and can’t do pirated shit on it. (Even transferring files with windows you need to jump through hoops) 

You can take a chance with Samsung’s tabs around 20-25k range, should still be playable with high or at least medium graphics but no clue how long they will be supported and other issues that crop up. There’s very few options in a decent tab market, specially for android
Pokemon emerald is the best for gba, great soundtrack too, I suggest you try that if you finish fire red(let’s be honest they’re a bit dated lol)
Thank you so much for the reply :)
